intro: Pavetta amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and often clasping the stem, giving it its common name. Pavetta amplexicaulis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky outcrops.
